intro: Streptanthus sagittatus, commonly known as the arrowleaf wintercress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Streptanthus sagittatus is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
